Why does AI hinder democratization?

This paper examines the relationship between democratisation and the development of AI and information and communication technology (ICT). The advancement of AI/ICT has hindered the development of democracy in many countries around the world, particularly in authoritarian and fragile democratic countries. The authors propose three hypotheses and use statistical tests to verify their argument, showing that AI/ICT advancements enable rulers to achieve better control over civil society forces, leading to the erosion of democracy.

Key Concepts:

  • How AI hinders democratization
  • Relationship between AI and democracy
  • Impact of technological advancements on democratic systems
  • Use of AI for surveillance and monitoring
  • Export of AI algorithms to authoritarian countries
  • Microtargeting individuals with tailored information
  • Production of deep-fakes and manipulated media
  • checks and balances
  • inverted-C relationship
  • statistical significance
